profiles.name: Jose Luis Rodríguez Hernandez
profiles.headline: Consultor BIM  Implementador BIM  Apasionado por la mejora continua y digitalización en la construcción
profiles.about: Soy un BIM Consultant apasionado por la transformación digital y la automatización de procesos de diseño. Soy experto en reingeniería de procesos, revisión constructiva, coordinación y modelado BIM, y en la enseñanza de Revit, Navisworks, BIM360 y Dynamo. Como BIM Manager, también demostré mis habilidades de organización y liderazgo en el Concurso BIM 2019 en España para el proyecto de Infraestructura, donde nuestro equipo ganó.Como mentor y formador, he influido positivamente en más de 16 000 estudiantes gracias a mis más de diez cursos en línea y a mi pertenencia al personal de Autodesk Expert Elite. Mi objetivo es convertirme en Project BIM Manager; quiero utilizar mis habilidades de programación y pensamiento crítico para producir más proyectos sostenibles y de alta calidad, integrando al mismo tiempo los procedimientos de gestión con la automatización y un enfoque de toma de decisiones basado en datos.Ponte en contacto conmigo en LinkedIn o a través de una de mis cuentas en las redes sociales para saber más sobre mí.Soy un BIM Consultant apasionado por la transformación digital y la automatización de procesos de diseño. education.degree: Data Science for Construction, Architecture and Engineering, Ciencia de datos para construcción, arquitectura e ingeniería
education.details: Este curso se centra en el desarrollo de habilidades de ciencia de datos para profesionales, específicamente en el sector del entorno construido. Está dirigido a arquitectos, ingenieros y gestores de edificios e instalaciones con poca o ninguna experiencia en programación. Introduce las habilidades de la ciencia de datos en el contexto de las fases del ciclo de vida del edificio. Los participantes utilizarán grandes conjuntos de datos abiertos de diseño, construcción y operaciones de edificios para aprender y practicar técnicas de ciencia de datos.

education.degree: Nano Grado Construcción 4.0, CienciasTecnología de la Arquitectura y la Construcción
education.details: El gran objetivo de Nanograde Construcción 4.0 es enseñar a aprovechar al máximo el potencial de la digitalización en el sector de la construcción, que es uno de los sectores con menor productividad digital. Algunos de los temas tratados son: cómo una estrategia de Marketing Digital puede ayudarles a aumentar la competitividad del sector, cómo un smartphone puede ayudarles a gestionar todos sus proyectos desde cualquier lugar sin necesidad de estar en la oficina, y cómo el Big Data y el IoT están cambiando el sector.

education.degree: Diploma de Educación, Ingeniería
education.details: Este curso presenta cómo adquirir pensamiento computacional para resolver problemas y tener pensamiento analítico para tener un impacto social positivo en los problemas cotidianos.

education.degree: Aprender a aprender, Educación
education.details: Este curso le facilita el acceso a las valiosas técnicas de aprendizaje utilizadas por expertos en arte, música, literatura, matemáticas, ciencias, deportes y muchas otras disciplinas. Aprenderemos cómo el cerebro utiliza dos modos de aprendizaje muy diferentes y cómo encapsula ("fragmenta") la información. También hablaremos de las ilusiones en el aprendizaje, las técnicas de memoria, cómo hacer frente a la procrastinación y las mejores prácticas que, según los estudios, son las más eficaces para ayudarte a dominar las asignaturas difíciles.

education.degree: Data Science, Machine Learning and AI for Bussines, Procesamiento de datos
education.details: Enseña los elementos esenciales de la ciencia de datos, big data y aprendizaje automático en los negocios. Enseña a tener una visión holística de las áreas de ciencia de datos, big data y aprendizaje automático en los negocios. Este curso enseña a comprender la terminología de big data y machine learning y a tomar decisiones empresariales que impliquen big data y machine learning. Además, a identificar qué soluciones son adecuadas para qué tipos de problemas, y cuándo los datos pueden añadir valor en diferentes etapas de los procesos de negocio.

profiles.name: Azinwie Zama
profiles.headline: BIM Specialist  Civil-Structural Engineer  Reg: 19-2562 N.O.C.E
profiles.about: Passionate EU-trained BIM Specialist  Licenced Civil-Structural Engineer Welcome to my professional corner! With Seven years of hands-on experience in the dynamic Architecture, Engineering, and Construction (AEC) industry, I bring a blend of technical proficiency and creative problem-solving to every project I undertake. Expertise Highlights: - Transforming concepts into reality through innovative computational design techniques. - Proficient in conducting complex structural analyses to ensure the robustness and integrity of designs. - Leveraging the power of Revit and Tekla Structures to craft meticulous BIM compliant models that serve as the backbone of construction projects. - Mastering clash detection and code checking in Navisworks for seamless coordination and quality assurance. - Proficient in quantity take-off and cost management, optimizing resources for efficiency and profitability. - Ensuring the longevity and functionality of built environments through comprehensive facility management strategies. Versatile Background:From the inception of grand designs to their realization, I've been privileged to contribute to several mega construction projects, overseeing every phase from design to construction. My skill set extends beyond the digital realm to encompass on-site supervision, construction management, and quantity surveying, providing a holistic approach to project delivery. Academic Journey:I hold a Master's degree in Civil Engineering from ENSPD, Universite of Douala, laying the foundation for my technical prowess. Additionally, I am a proud alumnus of the European Master's in Building Information Modelling (BIM A), an Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Program that honed my expertise at Politecnico di Milano (Italy), the University of Ljubljana (Slovenia), and the University of Minho (Portugal).Let's connect to explore synergies, share insights, and embark on transformative journeys in the realm of AEC. profiles.headline: IMFSE  Erasmus Scholar  M.Sc. Fire Safety Engineering  Civil Engineer  Research Engineer  Instructor
profiles.about: I am Jawad Bashir Mustafvi, an Erasmus Scholar currently pursuing an International Master of Science in Fire Safety Engineering (IMFSE), building on my foundation in Civil Engineering and my passion for innovation, sustainability, and digital engineering applications. In the IMFSE program, I am studying my first semester at Ghent University (Belgium), with subsequent semesters planned at Lund University (Sweden) and the Polytechnic University of Catalonia (Spain). The location for my thesis will be determined later. In addition to my formal education, I have completed many international online courses, enhancing my extensive research experience and proficiency in various digital tools. I earned a Bachelor of Science degree in Civil Engineering with honors from the University of Engineering and Technology Lahore in 2022, achieving the distinction of being on the Deans Honor Roll seven times and receiving multiple merit-based scholarships. Beyond academics, I have gained practical experience through various industry roles. In academia, as a Lab  Research Engineer in the Department of Civil Engineering at the University of Management and Technology Lahore, I developed and taught laboratory courses for undergraduate civil engineering students and contributed to innovative research projects focused on integrating advanced digital technologies into construction practices. I have published several research articles in HEC-approved journals and had the honor of presenting my findings at international conferences. Notably, my presentation at the International Conference on Digital Tool Applications for Cultural Heritage Sites Sustainability (ICDTA-2023) showcased my bachelor's research on preserving Lahore's heritage and evaluating fire risks. Additionally, I served as Director of Management for the Institution of Civil Engineers (ICE UET), an authorized chapter of ICE UK.My research interests encompass fire safety engineering, building information modeling, digital construction, risk assessment, safety management, heritage preservation, extended realities, machine learning, and artificial intelligence.I am Jawad Bashir Mustafvi, an Erasmus Scholar currently pursuing an International Master of Science in Fire Safety Engineering (IMFSE), building on my foundation in Civil Engineering and my passion for innovation, sustainability, and digital engineering applications. In the IMFSE program, I am studying my first semester at Ghent University (Belgium), with subsequent semesters planned at Lund University (Sweden) and the Polytechnic University of Catalonia (Spain). The location for my thesis will be determined later. In addition to my formal education, I have completed many international online courses, enhancing my extensive research experience and proficiency in various digital tools. I earned a Bachelor of Science degree in Civil Engineering with honors from the University of Engineering and Technology Lahore in 2022, achieving the distinction of being on the Deans Honor Roll seven times and receiving multiple merit-based scholarships. Beyond academics, I have gained practical experience through various industry roles. In academia, as a Lab  Research Engineer in the Department of Civil Engineering at the University of Management and Technology Lahore, I developed and taught laboratory courses for undergraduate civil engineering students and contributed to innovative research projects focused on integrating advanced digital technologies into construction practices. I have published several research articles in HEC-approved journals and had the honor of presenting my findings at international conferences. Notably, my presentation at the International Conference on Digital Tool Applications for Cultural Heritage Sites Sustainability (ICDTA-2023) showcased my bachelor's research on preserving Lahore's heritage and evaluating fire risks. Additionally, I served as Director of Management for the Institution of Civil Engineers (ICE UET), an authorized chapter of ICE UK. My research interests encompass fire safety engineering, building information modeling, digital construction, risk assessment, safety management, heritage preservation, extended realities, machine learning, and artificial intelligence. see more

profiles.about: En tant que fondateur et propriétaire de Artificial Modelling, je dirige une équipe compétente dans la fourniture de services BIM de premier plan à l'échelle mondiale. Notre expertise en coordination BIM, conversion de 2D en 3D, alignement de nuages de points et automatisation des processus nous distingue dans les domaines de la toiture, du bardage et de la coordination MEP dans des secteurs tels que les développements à usages mixtes, la santé et la pharmacie.Notre avantage réside dans notre capacité à fournir des services de haut niveau et rentables, en mettant l'accent sur la précision, l'innovation et une approche axée sur le client. Chez Artificial Modelling, nous combinons l'expertise technique avec l'insight créatif, transformant sans heurt les visions en réalités tangibles tout en assurant l'efficacité des coûts.Découvrez notre portefeuille étendu et rejoignez-nous pour redéfinir la coordination BIM. profiles.name: Aly Ahmed
profiles.headline: Research Assistant - PhD Candidate - Structural Engineer
profiles.about: Aly Ahmed is an Egyptian Structural Engineer with a keen interest in advanced sustainable materials research and Building Information Modelling (BIM) technologies. He graduated with a bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering from Ain Shams University in 2014 and subsequently completed his Master of Science degree from the same university in 2019. During his Master's studies, he focused on creating sustainable materials that can be produced using waste and by-products.In recognition of his efforts in researching Geopolymer concrete, Aly's thesis was awarded the Best Thesis Award from Ain Shams University for the 20192020 academic year. His first paper on the subject, "Performance of Geopolymer Concrete contacting recycled rubber", was also published in the prestigious "Construction and Building Materials" journal in 2019.Aly's passion for research led him to explore Building Information Modelling technologies in 2020, and he joined the BIM A committee as an Erasmus Mundus scholar. In 2022, he pursued an advanced Master's degree from two European universities - Politecnico di Milano (Italy) and Universidade do Minho (Portugal).In 2023, Aly began his PhD journey at Rowan University in the USA, where he is also a research assistant. He is part of a research group that focuses on Sustainable solutions for construction, Additive construction and manufacturing (Concrete 3D printing), Accelerated construction and repair, and Low Embodied carbon concrete and infrastructure (low to zero carbon negative).For those interested in following Aly's work, here are his Orcid ID, Scopus Page, and Google Scholar URLs:Orcid ID: 0000-0001-6226-7040Scoups Page: https:www.scopus.comauthiddetail.uri?authorId57206731137Google Scholar: https:scholar.google.comcitations?userfDyROVkAAAAJhlenAly Ahmed is an Egyptian Structural Engineer with a keen interest in advanced sustainable materials research and Building Information Modelling (BIM) technologies. He graduated with a bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering from Ain Shams University in 2014 and subsequently completed his Master of Science degree from the same university in 2019. During his Master's studies, he focused on creating sustainable materials that can be produced using waste and by-products. In recognition of his efforts in researching Geopolymer concrete, Aly's thesis was awarded the Best Thesis Award from Ain Shams University for the 20192020 academic year. His first paper on the subject, "Performance of Geopolymer Concrete contacting recycled rubber", was also published in the prestigious "Construction and Building Materials" journal in 2019. Aly's passion for research led him to explore Building Information Modelling technologies in 2020, and he joined the BIM A committee as an Erasmus Mundus scholar. In 2022, he pursued an advanced Master's degree from two European universities - Politecnico di Milano (Italy) and Universidade do Minho (Portugal). In 2023, Aly began his PhD journey at Rowan University in the USA, where he is also a research assistant. He is part of a research group that focuses on Sustainable solutions for construction, Additive construction and manufacturing (Concrete 3D printing), Accelerated construction and repair, and Low Embodied carbon concrete and infrastructure (low to zero carbon negative). For those interested in following Aly's work, here are his Orcid ID, Scopus Page, and Google Scholar URLs: Orcid ID: 0000-0001-6226-7040 Scoups Page: https:www.scopus.comauthiddetail.uri?authorId57206731137 Google Scholar: https:scholar.google.comcitations?userfDyROVkAAAAJhlen see more

profiles.about: I had started my career as an architect at Estúdio Sarasá Office, which is specialized in Restoration and Conservation of Buildings, Masterpieces and Monuments. In 2010, I worked at Links Consulting Projects and I developed public projects as Hospitals, Public Medical Centers and buildings that provide services of public interest. Thereafter, in 2011, I've started to work at Porta  Associados Office with the design of buildings and urban areas as well as with the training of a team of architects to work with the BIM technology.In 2013, I received the European Scholarship for develop the Erasmus Mundus Master Degree Program in which I concluded in 2015 with the Honourable Award (A Lode). honors_awards.award: 21st Scientific Expedition of Architecture Students to the Eastern Carpathians in Ukraine  THE HUTSUL LANDS 2019
honors_awards.date: Issued by StRuNa - Polish National Students' Movement  Nov 2019
honors_awards.description: In July 2019, I joined the 21st Scientific Expedition of Architecture Students to the Eastern Carpathians in Ukraine. Our team meticulously documented historical wooden Hutsul Orthodox churches, enriching our skills in architectural measurement and documentation. I developed complete drawing documentation of the Orthodox Church of the Nativity of the Holy Mother in Rusiv.Together with Adrianna Koch, I co-authored a comprehensive report detailing our expedition, which we presented at the 14th Symposium of Students' Scientific Clubs and the 11th edition of "Lodz U Like," before publishing it in a Polish-language book.Our team's commitment earned us the prestigious StRuNa 2019 Expedition of the Year award for our Hutsul project.

honors_awards.award: "100 for 100" Independence Anniversary Scholarship for 100 Outstanding Students in Poland
honors_awards.date: Nov 2018
honors_awards.associated_with: The "100 for 100" scholarship program, commemorating Poland's 100th independence anniversary, aimed to support Polish students who demonstrated an active attitude, motivation for challenges, and a positive impact on their environment. Out of nearly 1,800 applicants, only 100 students, including myself, were selected for this prestigious scholarship, backed by the honorary patronage of the Prime Minister. The scholarship recognized and supported individuals who excelled academically, had diverse interests, and actively contributed to their communities. Winning this scholarship among Poland's top 100 students was an honor and testament to my dedication and determination.

profiles.name: Timothy Augustus Y. Ong
profiles.headline: History and Conservation of Built Heritage in the Tropics  Getty GCI Graduate Intern  M. Architecture, Landscape, Archaeology
profiles.about: Timo is an architect and cultural heritage specialist focusing on the conservation of the built environment in hot-humid climates. His research and practice explore the intricacies of tropicality and tropical architecture, including their underlying power dynamics and colonial underpinnings negotiating their persistence within physical space and collective memory. With over 10 years experience, he has worked on landmarks including the Manila Metropolitan Theater, and the Rizal Memorial Coliseum. He received his B.S. in Architecture from the University of the Philippines (2016). In 2023, he was conferred an Erasmus Mundus Joint Masters Degree in Architecture, Landscape, and Archaeology, and was the 2024 Graduate Intern at the Getty Conservation Institute's Conserving Modern Architecture Initiative.Timo is an architect and cultural heritage specialist focusing on the conservation of the built environment in hot-humid climates. profiles.name: Sarah Loghman
profiles.headline: Biotechnology CRISPR-Cas9 Bioeconomy Genome Editing prime editing base editingAnalyzing Data λ Red recombineering statistical analysis enzyme engineering sustainability RNAseq analysis R programming
profiles.about: After graduating with a Bachelor's degree in Biotechnology from Shahid Beheshti University in 2020, I began an internship where I analyzed proteomics data using a top-down systems biology approach. During this project, I identified key biomarkers and critical pathways in breast cancer by examining large mass spectrometric datasets, utilizing gene set enrichment and pathway analysis. Following this, I pursued my masters studies in Biotechnology for the Bioeconomy at University of Milan. As an Erasmus exchange student at EMBL Partnership Institute of Vilnius University, I started my masters thesis on the editing of homologous enzymes, employing techniques such as λ Red Recombineering and Prime Editing to enhance enzymatic efficiency for CO2 fixation. Additionally, I utilized CRISPR-Cas9 for targeted selection. This project has also allowed me to strengthen my bioinformatics skills, applying R for statistical analysis and bash scripting in Linux for homologous protein identification. This experience has significantly expanded my knowledge in enzymatic research and environmental sustainability.After graduating with a Bachelor's degree in Biotechnology from Shahid Beheshti University in 2020, I began an internship where I analyzed proteomics data using a top-down systems biology approach. profiles.name: Cristiano Figueiredo
profiles.headline: Researcher
profiles.about: Passionate about merging cutting-edge technologies with traditional sectors, I am Cristiano Figueiredo, Ph.D., a researcher specializing in the convergence of innovation and industry. My academic journey includes a Ph.D. from the University of Bath in the UK and prior research experience at the University of Aveiro.Currently, I lead the Digitalization, Automation, and Robotics field within the Digital Manufacturing and Innovation unit at the Portuguese Footwear Technology Centre. My career focused on the integration of advanced technologies into more conventional fields, particularly leveraging digital tools.My primary focus lies in the transfer of technology - be it Automation, Robotics, or various digital solutions - into the dynamic realm of the footwear and leather goods industry. This falls under the broader spectrum of Industry 4.0, reflecting my commitment to propelling traditional sectors into the future.Beyond my research role, I wear multiple hats as a trainer and consultant. This dual role allows me to address the evolving needs of the sector, contributing to its modernization and staying at the forefront of industry trends.Passionate about merging cutting-edge technologies with traditional sectors, I am Cristiano Figueiredo, Ph.D., a researcher specializing in the convergence of innovation and industry. profiles.name: Henrique Vieira
profiles.headline: Hydrotechnical Engineer, MASc
profiles.about: Ingénieur en hydrologie et hydraulique intéressé par tout ce qui touche la gestion des eaux pluviales, particulièrement les infrastructures vertes. Au plaisir de discuter sur l'hydraulique ou tout sujet connexe!Mon expérience professionnelle précédente était très axée sur la conception des systèmes de drainage (ponceaux, réseaux d'égout pluvial, fossés, fossés de crête, drains, bassins de rétention, noues) pour des voies ferrées existantes et nouvelles, cours de triage et des réseaux d'égout pluvial pour le drainage d'autoroutes avec les principaux donneurs d'ouvrage (CN, CP, MTMD). Mon expérience académique portait sur l'évapotranspiration des lacs et milieux humides, mais naturellement je me suis approfondi aussi plus largement sur l'hydrologie globale de ces milieux. Un début de carrière en gestion de projet et surveillance en construction dans le domaine ferroviaire ajoutent un volet pratique à ma méthode de travail en tant que concepteur et chargé de projet.Ingénieur en hydrologie et hydraulique intéressé par tout ce qui touche la gestion des eaux pluviales, particulièrement les infrastructures vertes. profiles.name: Yiting Pan
profiles.headline: BEng, MSc, PhD Cantab., Distinguished Researcher in construction history and heritage conservation, Board Member of Construction History Society, Member of ICOMOS China
profiles.about: My academic credentials in built heritage are firstly demonstrated by my role as Associate Professor within the BEng programme in Historic Building Conservation at Soochow University, China, of which I am also a founding member. While serving in this role, I also obtained my teaching certificate for higher education in Architectural History and Theory.I received my broad and diverse education in built heritage and architecture from three world-renowned architecture programmes in China, Italy, and the UK. I primarily established my research expertise in built heritage during my PhD in Cambridge (UK) in 2011-2016. My PhD dissertation investigates the British influence and local tradition in building construction of 19th- and 20th-century architectural heritage in Shanghai. Prior to pursuing my PhD in Cambridge, I earned my Masters Degree cum laude in Architecture from Politecnico di Milan (Italy). My Masters programme at Politecnico allowed me to acquire solid expertise in architectural design contextualised to the history and culture of the place. Additionally, it equipped me with a systematic methodology to investigate the architectural and environmental heritage and to approach urban rehabilitation. Before my Masters Degree, I completed my undergraduate studies in Conservation of Architecture Heritage at Tongji University (China). I have obtained professional experience through internships in prize-winning architecture and conservation design studios in China (2007, 2008) and Italy (2010), where I contributed to the preparation of design, rehabilitation, and conservation projects.My academic credentials in built heritage are firstly demonstrated by my role as Associate Professor within the BEng programme in Historic Building Conservation at Soochow University, China, of which I am also a founding member. Doctor of Philosophy (PhD), Architecture
education.details: PhD supervisor: James W.P. CampbellMy PhD dissertation examines the relationship between native Chinese and Western construction methods in the development of the built environment in Shanghai. This choice of subject stemmed from (1) the concern that building conservation projects in present-day China are being carried out with insufficient understanding of historic materials and construction methods, resulting in a loss of authenticity; and from (2) the lack of any detailed analysis of building construction methods in books about historic Shanghai architecture. The dissertation calls for a better understanding, recognition, and preservation of historic building construction in Shanghai while taking into account the Sino-Western hybridity in materials and building techniques.

education.details: Ik volg de bachelor opleiding Bedrijfskunde aan de Hogeschool Utrecht. Tijdens deze studie duik ik in de wereld van informatie- en datamanagement, duurzaamheidsvraagstukken, strategie, marketing, finance, persoonlijk leiderschap en projectmatig werken. Na het behalen van mijn propedeuse in het eerste jaar van mijn studie Bedrijfskunde, heb ik mijn reis naar kennis en ervaring voortgezet met een ondernemende geest en een doelgerichte aanpak. In deze dynamische opleiding ben ik constant bezig met het leggen van verbindingen tussen strategische visies en praktische uitvoeringen.

education.degree: Mbo 4, Manager ondernemer Horeca
education.details: Met mijn achtergrond in HAVO kon ik mijn passie voor ondernemen en de horeca naar een hoger niveau tillen door mijn opleiding tot MBO Manager Horeca Ondernemer in slechts twee jaar af te ronden. Deze opleiding heeft mij voorbereid op alle aspecten van het runnen van een horecaonderneming.Van ondernemen en managen tot plannen, marketing, personeelsbeheer en financiën, ik heb een breed scala aan vaardigheden verworven die essentieel zijn voor het opzetten en onderhouden van een horecazaak. Deze studie had een goede combinatie van theorie en praktijk wat mij als jong persoon erg motiveerde.

Het bereidt je voor op vervolgstudies in bedrijfskunde, economie of gerelateerde vakgebieden.

profiles.name: Moemen Mastouri
profiles.headline: Mechanical engineer  Naval Architect  Marine engineer  Offshore Structural Engineer  Industrial systems engineer Ship Design Engineer
profiles.about: Hello everyone! My name is Momen, and I'm excited to share my professional journey with you. I hold a Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering with a specialization in design and manufacturing. Currently, I am pursuing a Master's degree in Industrial Systems Engineering, further expanding my knowledge and skills in this dynamic field.During my undergraduate studies, I gained a solid foundation in mechanical engineering principles and practices. I focused on areas such as CAD modeling, product development, and engineering analysis, which helped me develop expertise in designing and manufacturing mechanical systems. This background provided me with a strong technical base and a keen eye for detail.Driven by my passion for optimizing and improving complex systems, I decided to pursue a Master's degree in Industrial Systems Engineering. This program has allowed me to explore the broader aspects of systems optimization, process improvement, and resource allocation within industrial settings. I have gained valuable insights into areas such as process analysis, supply chain management, operations research, and quality control, which are crucial for enhancing productivity and efficiency.Throughout my academic journey, I have actively sought out opportunities to apply my skills and expand my knowledge. Engaging in various projects and coursework, I have developed a holistic approach to problem-solving and a deep understanding of the interconnectedness of different components within industrial systems. Combining my mechanical engineering background with the principles of industrial systems engineering has allowed me to approach challenges from multiple angles, ensuring comprehensive and effective solutions.In addition to my technical expertise, I have also cultivated skills in content creation, digital marketing, teamwork, customer relationship management, and project management. These complementary skills contribute to my ability to collaborate effectively in cross-functional teams and deliver impactful results.I am dedicated to continuous learning and staying updated with the latest advancements in industrial systems engineering. By embracing new knowledge and technologies, I strive to stay at the forefront of the field and make a meaningful impact in optimizing industrial processes.If you would like to learn more about my experiences and how we can collaborate, please feel free to reach out to me. education.institution: Università degli Studi di Napoli Federico II (UniNa)  University of Naples Federico II
education.degree: Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree, Sustainable Ship and Shipping 4.0 (SEAS 4.0)
education.details: Sustainable Ship and Shipping 4.0 (SEAS 4.0) is a year-and-half-long (90 ECTS) integrated, international, innovative, and methodologically diversified course to award a double Master Degree. It is taught in English and jointly designed by SEAS 4.0 Consortium Universities: University of Napoli Federico II, University of A Coruna,Technical University Hamburg and University of Zagreb.The development of the SEAS 4.0 Master Programme has been inspired by an emerging necessity to enlarge and improve the knowledge of Naval Architecture and Marine Engineering curricula with elements of Ship Management, Infologistics and Sustainability concepts in the frame of Industry 4.0. Such elements will be required skills for future Ship Designers, Marine Engineers and Ship Managers.

education.degree: Master of industrial engineering , Industrial Engineering
education.details: the course focused on Systems Engineering, Operations Research, Supply Chain Management, Production Planning and Control, Quality Engineering and Management, Industrial Data Analytics, Project Management, Human Factors Engineering, Simulation and Modeling, and Industrial Automation and Control. These courses cover topics ranging from system modeling and optimization to supply chain design, production planning, quality control, data analytics, project management, human factors considerations, simulation techniques, and industrial automation. These studies provide a comprehensive understanding of industrial systems and equip students with the skills to optimize processes, improve efficiency, and make informed decisions in various industrial settings.

education.degree: Licence professionnelle, Ingénierie mécanique
education.details: A Bachelor's program in Mechanical Engineering with a focus on design and manufacturing typically includes courses in mechanics of materials, thermodynamics, fluid mechanics, manufacturing processes, computer-aided design (CAD), machine design, control systems, engineering materials, engineering mechanics, industrial engineering, numerical methods, and project management. These courses provided us with a strong foundation in mechanical engineering principles, design methodologies, manufacturing techniques, and related disciplines, equiped me with the knowledge and skills necessary for a career in the field.

education.degree: Baccalauréat scientifique, Mathématiques computationnelles et appliquées
education.details: typically covers courses in calculus, linear algebra, discrete mathematics, probability and statistics, differential equations, abstract algebra, real analysis, numerical analysis, mathematical modeling, and mathematical logic. These courses provide students with a comprehensive understanding of different areas of mathematics, including foundational concepts, problem-solving techniques, and mathematical modeling skills. Through the program, students develop strong analytical thinking, logical reasoning, and mathematical proficiency, prepared for various careers in fields such as the one that I did "mechanical engineering"

profiles.headline: Naval Architect  Erasmus Mundus Scholar at Sustainable Ship and Shipping 4.0 (SEAS 4.0)  Intern Navantia, S.A. S.M.E  Digital Twin
profiles.about: With a solid foundation in Naval Architecture and Marine Engineering from the Universidade da Coruña , University of Naples Federico II and the National University of Sciences and Technology, I transitioned to an exciting role as an Intern at Navantia. There, I've been leveraging my problem-solving skills to innovate in digital transformation, focusing on automated material identification and ergonomic enhancements through virtual reality.At Navantia, my team and I have been creating a digital twin for the ship block fabrication facility, integrating myographic and haptic systems to refine workspace ergonomics. This effort underscores my commitment to advancing marine engineering through cutting-edge technology while embracing collaborative approaches that are synergistic with the organization's culture and values.With a solid foundation in Naval Architecture and Marine Engineering from the Universidade da Coruña , University of Naples Federico II and the National University of Sciences and Technology, I transitioned to an exciting role as an Intern at Navantia. Soy una persona asertiva con sentido de liderazgo y hábil para el trabajo independiente y en equipo, comprometida en la investigación y gestión de cambio gracias a la participación en actividades y proyectos de carácter social e ingenieril durante mi vida universitaria. Poseo capacidad para el relacionamiento interpersonal y talento artístico. Motivada en proveer y mejorar todos mis conocimientos para mi crecimiento personal y profesional.

profiles.about: I am a graduate in Naval Architecture with a strong command of software tools such as Rhino, AutoCAD, Creo, MS Office, Lumion, and MaxSurf. My team, NSME, has a proven track record in the WFSE competition, and I am a dedicated member of RINA. I have been honored with two medals from the Worldwide Ferry Safety Association competition. Additionally, I contributed to a detailed design project for an electric fishing boat, focusing on stability, seakeeping, structural analysis, and costing. Currently, I am pursuing my master's degree through the prestigious Erasmus Mundus SEAS 4.0 program, which integrates advanced knowledge in ship design and sustainable engineering across Italy, Spain, and Germany. profiles.name: Benhard Manullang
profiles.headline: MSc in Sustainable Ship and Shipping 4.0 (Erasmus Mundus Joint Master)  Naval Architect and Marine Engineering  Data Analyst  SalesService Engineer  Ex. Wilhelmsen Group
profiles.about: Benhard has 5 years experience as a port services engineer in Wilhelmsen Group and Apex Chemicals before continue his education in Europe. Currently, he is improving data analyst skill and implementation in Maritime fields. He was an intern at the Center for Research in Marine and Industrial Technologies (CITENI), Spain where he analyze maritime transport and energy efficiency. Graduated from Master's in Sustainable Ship and Shipping 4.0 (SEAS 4.0), an Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree Program co-funded by the European Union. His main interest is in maritime operation  fleet data analysis and shipping digitalization, especially in digital twin.He has experience in implementing statistical quality control, statistical process control, anomaly detection, and process capability analysis in the application of parametric control charts for uni-variate and multivariate data. They have used these techniques to monitor and forecast CO2 emissions based on ship navigation data, assess the operation of the Expanded Panama Canal, and evaluate the company's decarbonization and sustainability vision. He also developed dynamic dashboards and reports using Microsoft Power BI to gain valuable insights and identify areas for continuous improvement. He has bachelor's degree in Marine Engineering and multiple experiences in implementing industrial internet of things  marine digital twin in maritime sector and lean six sigma implementation.Benhard has 5 years experience as a port services engineer in Wilhelmsen Group and Apex Chemicals before continue his education in Europe. Currently, he is improving data analyst skill and implementation in Maritime fields. He was an intern at the Center for Research in Marine and Industrial Technologies (CITENI), Spain where he analyze maritime transport and energy efficiency. Graduated from Master's in Sustainable Ship and Shipping 4.0 (SEAS 4.0), an Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree Program co-funded by the European Union. His main interest is in maritime operation  fleet data analysis and shipping digitalization, especially in digital twin. He has experience in implementing statistical quality control, statistical process control, anomaly detection, and process capability analysis in the application of parametric control charts for uni-variate and multivariate data. They have used these techniques to monitor and forecast CO2 emissions based on ship navigation data, assess the operation of the Expanded Panama Canal, and evaluate the company's decarbonization and sustainability vision. He also developed dynamic dashboards and reports using Microsoft Power BI to gain valuable insights and identify areas for continuous improvement. He has bachelor's degree in Marine Engineering and multiple experiences in implementing industrial internet of things  marine digital twin in maritime sector and lean six sigma implementation.

education.degree: Bachelor's degree, Marine Engineering
education.details: Thesis title: Dispersion Estimation of Ship Gas Emission Using Langrangian Particle Dispersion Model (LPDM) Based on Automatic Identification System (AIS): Madura Strait Case Study.In short description, thesis is collecting, transforming, and cleaning data from Automatic Identification System (AIS) and modelling the data to estimate the ship emission and the dispersion in Madura Strait. By analyzing the the AIS data trend, we can evaluate the ship operational behavior and provide data-driven suggestion to control the ship emission in the area.

profiles.name: Muhammad Safi Ullah_1
profiles.headline: Offshore Loads Project Engineer  Offshore Wind 𖣘  Erasmus Masters  SEAS 4.0
profiles.about: As a Mechanical Engineer and Naval Architect with a strong background in structural mechanics, wave theory and much more. I am currently supporting the Offshore Structural Dynamics department at Jörss - Blunck - Ordemann (JBO). My primary responsibilities include the estimation of advanced wave loads through numerical simulations and conducting run-up studies on offshore structures. I also, have a good overview of key design principles, particularly in relation to limit states such as ULS (Ultimate Limit State) and FLS (Fatigue Limit State).In addition to wave loads, I also am passionate about corresponding structural dynamics i.e. behaviour of structure to the loads applied. This is something I learning along the way. I am eager to connect with professionals who share my enthusiasm for offshore wave induced loads.As a Mechanical Engineer and Naval Architect with a strong background in structural mechanics, wave theory and much more. I am currently supporting the Offshore Structural Dynamics department at Jörss - Blunck - Ordemann (JBO). My primary responsibilities include the estimation of advanced wave loads through numerical simulations and conducting run-up studies on offshore structures. I also, have a good overview of key design principles, particularly in relation to limit states such as ULS (Ultimate Limit State) and FLS (Fatigue Limit State). In addition to wave loads, I also am passionate about corresponding structural dynamics i.e. behaviour of structure to the loads applied. This is something I learning along the way. I am eager to connect with professionals who share my enthusiasm for offshore wave induced loads.

profiles.name: Igor Bačkalov
profiles.headline: Naval Architect  Senior Research Associate
profiles.about: Naval architect experienced with both research projects and engineering assignments, member of the team awarded with the RINA-Lloyds Register Ship Safety Award for 2007. Holds PhD degree in technical sciences.Participated in long-term technology research associated with future developments in design and operation of seagoing and inland cargo vessels. PhD thesis on nonlinear motions of ships in realistic  extreme weather conditions, and development of innovative risk-based ship stability regulations. Published a number of scientific papers.Notable short-term assignments included: calculations of a wave energy conversion device; investigations of stability accidents on the Danube; stability analysis of an innovative inland container vessel design; assessment of buoyancy and stability of atypical floating structures equipped with large cranes (used in construction of bridges); seakeeping of a jack-up rig in wet tow in the South China Sea; a salvage operation of damaged and grounded cargo ship in Adriatic. Experienced with software for hydrostatics and ship motions calculations. Experienced with European RD projects. Member of the expert group on external costs in inland navigation, in the FP6 Coordination Action IMPRINT-NET. Member of the project team in the FP7 Collaborative Project MoVe IT. Leader of the University of Belgrade research group in the EU Danube Region Strategy project Innovative Danube Vessel. Leader of the University of Belgrade research group in the H2020 project NOVIMAR. Member of the project team in the H2020 project NOVIMOVE. Work package leader in the HEU project AUTOFLEX. Member of the project management task force in the HEU project SYNERGETICS.Interested in positions and projects related to ship technology (design, stability, seakeeping) and sustainable transport solutions (inland waterways, maritime transport, intermodal transport).Specialties: Ship stability and seakeeping studies; Risk-based ship stability regulations; Nonlinear ship motions; Dynamic stability of ships; International maritime regulations; Inland waterway transport.Naval architect experienced with both research projects and engineering assignments, member of the team awarded with the RINA-Lloyds Register Ship Safety Award for 2007. profiles.name: Muhammad Safi Ullah_2
profiles.headline: Offshore Loads Project Engineer  Offshore Wind 𖣘  Erasmus Masters  SEAS 4.0
profiles.about: As a Mechanical Engineer and Naval Architect with a strong background in structural mechanics, wave theory and much more. I am currently supporting the Offshore Structural Dynamics department at Jörss - Blunck - Ordemann (JBO). My primary responsibilities include the estimation of advanced wave loads through numerical simulations and conducting run-up studies on offshore structures. I also, have a good overview of key design principles, particularly in relation to limit states such as ULS (Ultimate Limit State) and FLS (Fatigue Limit State).In addition to wave loads, I also am passionate about corresponding structural dynamics i.e. behaviour of structure to the loads applied. This is something I learning along the way. I am eager to connect with professionals who share my enthusiasm for offshore wave induced loads.As a Mechanical Engineer and Naval Architect with a strong background in structural mechanics, wave theory and much more. I am currently supporting the Offshore Structural Dynamics department at Jörss - Blunck - Ordemann (JBO). My primary responsibilities include the estimation of advanced wave loads through numerical simulations and conducting run-up studies on offshore structures. I also, have a good overview of key design principles, particularly in relation to limit states such as ULS (Ultimate Limit State) and FLS (Fatigue Limit State). In addition to wave loads, I also am passionate about corresponding structural dynamics i.e. behaviour of structure to the loads applied. This is something I learning along the way. I am eager to connect with professionals who share my enthusiasm for offshore wave induced loads.
